Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [knocks water bottle on to Jim's desk] Oh, little help. Wow your hair is really thinning.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Standing is proven to be healthier, increases productivity and just looks cooler. Picture someone doing something heroic. Now was he sitting or standing? Not counting FDR.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Every second you sit there is an hour off your life. Look at all of you. I feel like you're in a suicide cult.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No. No. No. You're way off on that one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you really comfortable standing there? I tried one of those and I just never hit the sweet spot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey guys let's just all admit it. Ok? Dwight's better than us. He had the guts to stop sitting. And he's never, ever going to go back on it right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's right Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [jumping up from an almost sitting position] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Taking a load off huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Putting a load on more like it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Good luck with that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Last thing I need is luck. [hunches down again]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Angela] Thank you so much. [hums]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sees a pole poking out Dwight's pant leg] What are you up to? Oops look out! [grabs Dwight's wallet]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing? Give that back. Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Prank! [throws money from Dwight's wallet on the floor]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh that's real creative.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what it's not my best. Because you could just easily bend over and pick it up right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I could, but I just don't feel like it loser.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because you're sitting?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Standing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because you're sitting?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Standing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know I have to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know. [Jim pushes him over, Dwight screams]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [signing his name] Andrew... Baines... Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you could just do Andy Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Andrew Baines Bernard. I love filling these out. Because it's like taking a test, but I know the answers.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [loudly knocking on the window] In four seconds my wife is going to be coming through that door. I told her she could work here. Under no circumstances can that be allowed to happen. [to Mrs. California] There you are! Honey how on earth could you miss the elevator?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. He wasn't talking to me. But if I were you I wouldn't hire his wife.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's why my foundation - The Dream for a Wish Foundation - is going to put them out of business. They're not going to know what hit them.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Everyone. I'd like to introduce my wife Mrs. Robert California. Mrs. California this is everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Hello. Oh call me Susan please.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Last night at dinner Susan and I were talking about her returning to work. So she's here today to see if there's a good fit. Something tells me it just might work out. This is Andy Bernard the regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Hello nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey there. It's a pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy would you be so kind as to show Susan around the office. Show her the various departments. Find a place where she'll shine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I would love to. But I have to be completely honest with you guys. We're 100 percent staffed up.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy. Let's see if there's a good fit first. Then we'll talk.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Knock, knock, knock, knock, knock.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You don't have to say it if you're doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] Remember how you said that you were looking in the office to do calisthenics and aerobics?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh weight lifting yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well today's your lucky day. I have opened in this very office building Dwight Schrute's Gym for Muscles. You wanna take a look?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll take a look.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your path from obesity begins right here!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I've been meaning to join a gym. [narrating over a montage of scenes with him and Val] For my health. I used to say I wanted to live long enough to see a black President. I didn't realize how easy that would be. So now I want to live long enough to see a really, really gay President. Or a supermodel President. I want to see all the different kinds of Presidents.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Obese people in my office are a drain on resources. Chairs wear out faster, it takes more Freon to keep them cool, they flush the toilets more often, plus their massive BMs bust the rivets on my pipes. But a gym turns fat into cash.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright! The DM Express is pulling out.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Well it was really nice to meet you Brian.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Actually Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Oh, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Bitttch!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We will start here at Erinville.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hoo-hoo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Reception. Your classic one-man operation.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Although I was watching a movie and Merryl Streep had two secretaries.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was watching a movie and a bunch of apes took over San Francisco. Just saying.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Two secretaries could convey a sense of importance and success to our clients. Certainly worth exploring; wouldn't you agree Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll explore exploring it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Good. It seems like you have this under control. So I'll just duck out and run the company for a while.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok uh next stop on the tour sales. Here we go. Station stop Jim Halpert. Oh boy our resident truth teller. [Jim laughs nervously] Alright have at it. Let 'er rip. What do you hate about this place?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well it's sales. So you have to be able to live in the world of rejection.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe you do. Hi. I'm Dwight. Sales is really not so hard ok? It's paper. We have it and they want it so bad they are willing to pay for it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well it's not that easy. It's kind of sometimes difficult.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's the second easiest job in the world. [to camera] Being a mom.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: I love shopping and sales is just the other side of that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is true.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know if you joined our sales department you would be working very closely with our department head Mr. Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight why don't you tell Susan about some of your hobbies. Survival skills. Ranking of animals.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe over a beer after she's closed her first sale [makes gun click noise].

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Well make that a red wine and I'll tell you my animal rankings [makes gun click noise back].

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh how am I supposed to pull this off? [montage of office workers in friendly interactions with Susan]. The entire office is being nice to her than they've ever been to me. What I wouldn't give for one of Phyllis' classic room clearing farts right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ready? What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Um no. This is not a gym. This is like a scene out of Saw 5.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You haven't even looked around yet. Look. Gravel bucket squat yoke [squats, grunts and lifts] Right? Dedicated phone book ripping station [tries and fails to tear a phone book in half]. You ever cut tin before? Five yards in and your forearms will be on fire. Plus I will buy the tin back from you that you cut for two cents a yard. Now let's go over membership. I'm going to need the first month's and the last month's up front. $49 per month. But every third month is $59 a month. But the fourth month is a discount month at $19 per month...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Obviously you know how a gym works. So you know I'm not going to pay money for this. You want people to come to your gym? Make a real gym.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Darryl... [picks up sledgehammer and swings it at a hanging tire]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Make a real gym.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: I was thinking accounting might be a good fit because I really clicked with Oscar and I do have some experience in bookkeeping.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But we already have a surplus of accountants as it is.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Uh I could work in customer service. HR even.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Those are fully staffed as well.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Are you telling me that there's no one in this entire office that could use an extra pair of hands?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [laughing nervously] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I am the CEO and I am telling an employee of mine what to do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let me beat around the bush for a second. Our chairman of the board has some very strong feelings about-

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Robert this is very uncomfortable. Obviously there's no place for me here. So thank you for trying. Why don't we just let it go.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No. Absolutely not. Andrew there must be something you can do. Think.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There are lots of considerations.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I would be eternally grateful. It's not a bad thing to have the CEO owe you one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright. Well then welcome aboard.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: So what happens next?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We get you over to HR and then we get you set up with accounting. [phone rings] Hang on. Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [on phone] Say hello grandma.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi gam-gam.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hold one finger up to Susan. You'll just be a second. You numbskull. You were given a very simple task. I could not have been more clear with you. Now say, "are you taking your medicine?"

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you taking your med-meds?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Why can you not say exactly what I tell you? Undo this. Undo it. [Robert and Andy hang up phones]

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: You didn't say goodbye to your grandma.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We promised we'd never say goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention! I am now accepting memberships for Dwight Schrute's Gym for Muscles. The first 20 members can take advantage of the pay what you weigh promotion.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: All I need is another gym. As if I don't have enough drama.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We have a gym at home. It's called the bedroom.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Who's spotting who? Don't use the bike in the corner. That's Bruce's. Jeremy says...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Enough Oscar, enough.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I have these new sneakers which are basically like a gym for your feet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's okay. I know how to build a business. You gotta get the black people to do it to get the white people to do it. Then you gotta get the black people to stop doing it. One step at a time.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Did you bring your passport with you?

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Who walks around with their passport?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, I do. Always ready for adventure.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Have you had any?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sees Susan is busy in the annex] Hey, uh, guys. So Robert doesn't want his wife working here. So now that she is, we have to drive her away.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy, if he didn't want her working here then why did you hire her?

Quote.Speaker: Andy/Oscar
Quote.Text: it was a mistake. But one that can be fixed by all of us being mean to her.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: How can we do that? She's simply wonderful.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is all pathetic.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am not asking, I am ordering.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How mean are we talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It would be great if she were gone by lunch. Erin, you're up. Find her a place to work, but not too comfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Got it. I know exactly which stapler to give her.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Here you go. [gives Susan a tiny stapler]

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Um, do you think it would be possible to move to that desk over there? Because this seems a bit cramped and I don't have a computer.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well that's a sales desk.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. You need to be over here with us accountants. Just sit here and be quiet. And if you have a question, just raise your hand. But I'm gonna save you some time, sweetie, and give you the answer now. I. Don't. Know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I don't think we should be trying to make this place seem unpleasant. I think we should let this place just crush her spirit by itself. I mean, it knows what it's doing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's Gerald. [hands phone to Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. So cute.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Oh, that is so cute-

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [grabs phone] Aw... He's so tiny. Is he in a ladle?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, he's in a ladle.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's adorable. How on earth did you get him in a ladle?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He did it himself.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Is that ladle stainless or...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, stainless. Williams Sonoma.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Excuse me, waiter, there's a dog in my soup. [Jim chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's not that kind of ladle.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Very cute. [holds out the phone]

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Aw, let me see-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [grabs phone] Ah, just the battery on these things. I'm sorry, I've got to recharge this.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: I get it. Last time I had a job, I remember I hated the boss' wife. Of course, she was married to Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Your employees don't seem to be taking to me.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy! Andy, could you step in here, please? We'll fix this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in robot voice] What is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Please. Andrew, my wife... has brought up an issue that requires your attention. So, uh, if you'll excuse me, I should step out, get to the ATM before that homeless man sets up camp for the night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okey-dokey, artichokey. You hate it, don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Do you not want me here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why would you say that?

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: It's okay. I understand. I'm not sure how I would feel about having the boss' wife work for me either.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's not that, exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: But it is something.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's just say that if you don't want to work here, I am totally prepared to respect that.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Why would you not want me working here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: I think I understand what you're going through. My husband can be a very difficult man to read, can't he?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! The dude is an enigma.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. So he is mixed up in this, isn't he?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah... [stammers]

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you think you're doing?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Getting my sweat on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I build you this temple to the human body, and you're lifting what, five pounds?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I just did, like, 35 minutes on the treadmill.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was watching you. You want to know how long it really was?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eight minutes!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dude, I'm gonna be here all week, right? Five days a week, I figure I'll start slow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that the same philosophy you apply to buffalo wings? [points] I want you to bring that same buffalo wing passion to this gym! I'm gonna make you look like Lebron James!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's Lejon Brames.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's what I said.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You know, get it right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Susan] Cameras...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [enters] Oh, still here. Terrific.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Andy and I had a great conversation. And I just want to let you know that I am not going to be working here.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well that's a shame.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It just was one of those things-

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Is it? Because we talked about it and it seems like that might be what you want. Which is fine.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Where did this come from? Did Andy say that?

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: No, he did not, but I could tell he was struggling to understand what was expected of him.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: What's the struggle? He made a great call, hired a great person.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: You sure about that?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: No games?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No games.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Because Andy seemed to think there was some information he was not able to share with me.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Okay, enough of this. I mean, really, enough. It's gotten way out of hand. Andrew, this is my wife. Whatever privacy you were trying to protect between us, I thank you for. But it is not welcome right now. Just be honest.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Why do you keep looking at my husband?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, just answer the question.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No games?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No games.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay. I mean, it was kind of funny, actually. Robert storms in and he says, "in four seconds, my wife's gonna be in here. I told her she could work here. Under no circumstances can that be allowed to happen." [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You lying son of a bitch!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Tell my wife you're lying.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am lying. I am a compulsive liar.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: That's not true, is it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, it's not. I tell the truth most of the time and I was just telling the truth about your husband. Jim knows. He was there.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: This is preposterous.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Robert...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Let's get Jim in here. [Jim shoves out of fram in his chair, Robert looks for Jim] Where's Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He just rolled out and crawled out.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Can you call security, tell 'em to keep an eye out for him? Time to settle this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Hank who is closing the gate] Oh wait, wait, wait! Hold on, hold on. I just need to get through. Just real quick. Real quick, open... uh, okay. [runs]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [sees Jim's abandoned car] That's weird. Well, he's gotta be around here somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [shoe falls while climbing ladder] Oh. Ow. Ow. Ow. [grunts] Creed. I was never here, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Okay. What about your friend?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh boy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is my gym, my rules. You do exactly as I say, no questions asked.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm gonna ask questions and I might not do what you say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: First thing, we're gonna stretch the pelvic bowl. Ready? Get down on the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm not doing that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? Too embarrassing for you? Huh? You wish that every exercise was strutting around the gym like the Fonz? Well how do you think the Fonz got so cool? He stretched his pelvic bowl!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I didn't know Darryl joined.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Looks that way.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Nice pelvic bowl. Deep.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hello Jim. [Jim tries to escape]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [grabs Jim's leg] No, no. No, no, no! Don't! Damn it, Tuna!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: So I think you know what we want to know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do I?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [mutters] I know, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim, I've had enough of your unhelpfulness.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I really wish I could help. I'm not really sure how I can...

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: For God's sake, did Robert tell you that he didn't want me working here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's the thing. See, I didn't want to get in the middle of this. Still don't. But here's something: I feel that maybe, if we take a step back, this is a simple case of anxiety to work with a spouse.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [laughs] I think we've got ourselves an answer.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That makes complete sense. Thank you all for a wonderful day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect!

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Jim...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Answer the question, please.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sighs] I don't know what you want me to tell you. To be really honest, my wife works here. And I love it. She literally makes me work harder. She makes me smarter. She makes me remember why I'm here. And between us, she's on maternity leave right now, and I would love to leave this room and see her face. I would love it. I don't know how this helps, but it's just what I'm thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: All right. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. All right. Great. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: [Robert holds the door, she walks through] Thank you. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [claps Andy's shoulder] Heh.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Mrs. California.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Hey. Uh, I'm sorry about the position you were put in today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, honestly, we all wanted you to work there. Except for him. Especially me.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I thought we really hit it off.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Well, different circumstances.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Who knows?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who knows?

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: Maybe after all this settles down...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Totally.

Quote.Speaker: Susan
Quote.Text: It's a date.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're nothing! You're so weak, you call yourself a man? Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This doesn't help me. I don't respond to that kind of strategy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. Finish your set on your own and never come back to my gym again!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dwight, come back and spot me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, I'll help you. But first, you gotta tell me what your goal is. What do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: To push this bar up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! Because if that was the case, the bar would be up by now. What is your goal?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Help me!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you want!?!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: To look good for Val!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Val Kilmer? I don't buy it. That doesn't make any sense. Wow... I figured out your goal. I am going to make you the buffest dude Val Kilmer has ever seen.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: They say that if you can strengthen your core, it improves your sexual performance. So, you will find me on the Ab-Blaster. And then you will find me blasting...uh, a very nice young woman.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Gotta get in shape. I'm doing Ironman next month. And I want him to be attracted to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, what are you listening to?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Steve Martin. [laughs, then falls] uh, I'm fine. [grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Um, where's the shower?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is no shower.

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: There isn't?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What does this look like, a shower store? Get lost.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You have got to be kidding me! No shower?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Exercise lengthens life. Improves mood, boosts sex drive, and I've already covered the BM of it all. It's miraculous the effect that I will have on their lives.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, Roberto Californio doesn't want to work with his wife. I get it. And, he wants to give his wife a job. Totally get it. What I am struggling with is the part of this that's impossible.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I love my wife.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This whole thing is making me very uncomfortable. I'm not getting between the boss and his wife so just ask me about something else. You know Stanley's tie is really the story of the day...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's my birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, so that's a disaster. Luckily have a two-part plan. One, run. Two, hide. It's pretty smart, right? [walks into Vance Refrigeration office] Hi, how you doing? I'm Jim Halpert from across the hall. We are redoing our supply closet and I was wondering if I could take a look at yours for some ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Bob's Secretary
Quote.Text: Let me just check with Bob.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You absolutely should. He said it was ok, so till you get him, I'll just be in, you know. [closes door behind him to supply closet]

Quote.Speaker: Bob's Secretary
Quote.Text: [on phone] Bob? Jim just went into the closet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ugh! He's always one step ahead of us! How does he do that?

Quote.Speaker: Mrs. California
Quote.Text: This is insulting!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: This whole accusation is insulting. Come on.
